intro: Eleocharis morroi, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is typically found in wetland environments, such as marshes and pond margins, where it thrives in moist to aquatic conditions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Eleocharis morroi is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
